Nonfeasance.definition: the failure or omission to do something that should be done or esp. something that one is under a duty or obligation to do compare malfeasance
Nonfeasance.origin: [ non- + obsolete English feasance doing, execution, from Anglo-French fesance , from Old French faisance act, from fais- , stem of faire to do, from Latin facere ]

1.1: the failure or omission to do something that should be done or esp. something that one is under a duty or obligation to do compare
